AddressCommonName.CommonPlaceName: IL BTWN BMP AND SEC LS
O/L I-695 PRIOR TO SECURITY BLVD

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
Maryland State Police Golden Ring DUI #23-204
Trooper Ericksen #7438
Case Number: 23-MSP-013314
Citations: 1BK0Y2Q – 1BS0Y2Q                                                   

CERTIFICATIONS:

-National Highway Safety Transportation Administration (NHSTA) certified to conduct Standardized Field Sobriety Test (SFST)
- Preliminary Breath Test (PBT) Operator
- Certified police officer in the state of Maryland with over 40 hours of training in DUI detection with live donors at the Maryland State Police Academy.

Video Recording Information: 

Maryland State Police patrol vehicle MV-33 is not equipped with an in-car camera system. I am equipped with a body worn camera. The following incident was audibly and visually recorded on my body worn camera. All video requests can be emailed to Sgt. Twardowski at joseph.twardowski@maryland.gov. 

Scene Processing:

The suspect vehicle was towed by Hebbville Towing. No further scene processing was required.

Witness Statements / Neighborhood Check:

There were no witnesses to this incident. Due to the nature of the incident, a neighborhood check was not completed.

Action Taken: 

SUSPECT:

Dayauna Nytrice Thompson
613 GIBSON RD, BALTIMORE, MD 21229
B/F DOB: 06/12/1997

VICTIM:
Estella Ijeoma Ogbonna
3420 SONIA TRL APT 102, ELLICOTT CITY, MD 21043
B/F DOB: 07/21/1972

State of Maryland 

VEHICLE IN MOTION:

On April 15th, 2022 at approximately 0110 hours, I, Trooper Ericksen # 7438, assigned to the Maryland State Police Golden Ring Barrack, was dispatched to the area of I-695 and Security Boulevard for a two (2) vehicle collision with injuries. Upon my arrival, I observed a Chevy Cruze, bearing MD registration 6DP3769, with rear damage and a Mazda CX5, bearing MD registration 7ES9991, with front damage.

PERSONAL CONTACT:

I made contact with the at fault operator of the Mazda. The operator of the Mazda was identified by her name and date of birth as Dayauna Nytrice Thompson (B/F DOB: 06/12/1997). Thompson had bloodshot, watery, glassy eyes, and slurred speech. While speaking with Thompson, I immediately detected a strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emanating from her breath and person. Based on the following, Thompson was asked to perform Standardized Field Sobriety Tests. Due to Thompson’s level of intoxication, while walking to the back of Thompson’s vehicle, Thompson lost her balance while stepping up onto the curb and fell onto the ground. I assisted Thompson up from the ground and walked to the back of her vehicle.

Bloodshot, watery, glassy eyes, slurred speech
Strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emanating from Thompson's breath and person
Poor coordination

PRE-ARREST SCREENING:

I asked Thompson the following questions to which she replied “No.”
 
  • Injuries that would prevent her from walking/balancing
  • Glasses or Contacts
  • Medical Conditions
  • Prescription Medications on a daily basis
  • Marijuana

Thompson appeared to be in good physical condition and did not display any visible injuries and/or defects. Thompson advised that she had consumed “two or three” alcoholic beverages of tequila.
 
The Standardized Field Sobriety Tests were performed behind Thompson’s vehicle on flat, dry pavement free of any obvious debris. 
 
HORIZONTAL GAZE NYSTAGMUS: 

The first test given was the Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus test. The tip of my right index finger was used as the test’s stimulus and was held approximately 12-15 inches from Thompson’s eyes. I asked Thompson if she could see the tip of my finger, to which she replied “Yes”. Thompson was instructed to look straight ahead and keep her head still while following the stimulus with her eyes only. Her pupils were equal in size and showed equal tracking. Thompson’s eyes are brown in color. I observed the following clues:

Lack of Smooth Pursuit - present in both eyes
Distinct and Sustained Nystagmus at Maximum Deviation - present in both eyes
Onset of Nystagmus prior to 45 degrees – present in both eyes

HGN (6/6 Clues observed)

WALK AND TURN:

Prior to Thompson performing the test, I properly explained and demonstrated how the test should be conducted. Thompson was instructed to imagine a straight line in front of her, place her left foot on the line and place her right foot directly in front of her left and have her feet touch heel to toe. Thompson was instructed and demonstrated to place her hands flat at her sides and remain at her side. Thompson was advised to remain in the instructional position until I completed explaining/demonstrating the test. Thompson was advised to take nine steps touching heel to toe on each step. Thompson was advised to keep her hands flat at her side and to count out every step out loud. On the ninth step, Thompson was explained and demonstrated to keep her lead foot planted and to take a series of small steps around with her rear foot to the left to turn around. Thompson was again explained and demonstrated the second series of nine steps were to be performed identically to the first nine steps. Thompson was informed that once she started the test, she was to not stop until she completed the test, keeping her hands down at her sides, counting out loud, looking down at her feet.  

INSTRUCTIONAL STAGE:

Could not maintain balance
Begins walking prior to being instructed to do so

WALKING STAGE (1st Nine):

Stepped off line
Missed heel-toe

TURN:

Thompson completed the turn unsatisfactory. 

WALKING STAGE (2nd Nine):

Stepped off line
Missed heel-toe

WALK AND TURN (5/8 clues observed)

ONE LEG STAND: 

Prior to Thompson performing the test, I properly explained and demonstrated how the test should be performed. Thompson was instructed to stand with her heels together and hands down by her side while the instructions were given. When instructed to start, she was to raise the foot of her choice approximately 6 inches off the ground. While her leg was raised she was to keep the leg straight, watch her raised foot, and to count out loud by thousands (One thousand one, one thousand two, etc.). While performing the test, she was instructed to keep her arms down by her sides. She was instructed to continue the test until told to stop. She was instructed that if for any reason she put her foot down, to pick it back up and continue with the test. Thompson chose to balance on her left foot, raising her right foot for the test.
 
BALANCE AND COUNTING:

Put Foot Down 
Swayed from side to side 
Hopped

ONE LEG STAND (3/4 clues observed) 

PRELIMINARY BREATH TEST: 

The preliminary breath test was offered to Thompson. Thompson refused. 

ARREST:

At approximately 0140 hours, I placed Thompson under arrest for driving under the influence. Thompson was handcuffed and searched incident to arrest prior to being placed in the front passenger seat of my patrol vehicle per department policy and her seat belt was applied. While inside of my patrol vehicle, Thompson was played the English audio version of the DR15 from the MVA website while still on scene. At approximately 0200 hours, Thompson refused to submit to an alcohol concentration test. At approximately 0239 hours, after finishing the required paperwork and Thompson’s friend, Haneef Hardy arrived, Thompson was released. Thompson was issued the appropriate citations and pertinent paperwork and released to the care of her friend.

All events occurred in Baltimore County, Maryland.

Disposition:

Thompson was placed under arrest, issued the appropriate citations and pertinent paperwork.

Case Status:

I respectfully request this case be closed by arrest.
